page.title: 16Theatres in Swansea
page.content: {Swansea is lucky to have two theatres. The oldest is the{Grand Theatre}which is owned by the council. As part of urban renewal Â£5,000,000 has just been spent on improving the facilities. Events in the Grand include plays on their pre-London run, ballet, opera and music hall. Some people would like to rename the Grand as a memorial to the late{Richard Burton. In 1979 the{Swansea Little Theatre bought a car saleroom to convert into a permanent home for them. This theatre is in Gloucester Place near the new marina. Much of the conversion has been done by members themselves and they produce plays about six times a year. They named their theatre after{Dylan Thomas}the famous Swansea poet and playwright.
